support_summary: Protein kinase C beta (PRKCB) directly phosphorylates TFEB on several C-terminal serine residues. This phosphorylation event increases the stability of the TFEB protein, leading to its accumulation and enhanced transcriptional activity.

functions.cellular_process: Protein Kinase C Beta (PRKCB) directly phosphorylates TFEB on multiple serine residues in its C-terminal region (e.g., S462, S463, S467, S469).
functions.effect_description: Phosphorylation by PRKCB enhances the stability and activity of the TFEB protein, leading to an accumulation of TFEB and subsequent upregulation of its target genes.
biological_consequence: PRKCB phosphorylates TFEB at C-terminal serines (S462, S463, S467, S469) → TFEB protein is stabilized, increasing its half-life → Stabilized TFEB protein accumulates in the cell → TFEB enhances transcription of target genes → Lysosomal biogenesis is promoted
specific_effects: Stabilizes the TFEB protein, increasing its half-life.
Phosphorylates TFEB at sites distinct from the inhibitory mTORC1 sites.
Contributes to lysosomal biogenesis in specific contexts, such as osteoclast function.

evidence.paper_title: A RANKL-PKCβ-TFEB signaling cascade is necessary for lysosomal biogenesis in osteoclasts
evidence.authors: Ferron M, Settembre C, Shimazu J, Lacombe J, Kato S, Rawlings DJ, Ballabio A, Karsenty G
evidence.assay: In vitro kinase assay, Western Blot
evidence.relevant_quote: This occurs following PKCβ phosphorylation of TFEB on three serine residues located in its last 15 amino acids. This post-translational modification stabilizes and increases the activity of this transcription factor.

evidence.paper_title: The regulatory mechanism and therapeutic potential of transcription factor EB in neurodegenerative diseases
evidence.authors: Wang JH, Li Y, Wang Y, An B, Wang YN, Chen Y, Chen C, Liu XG
evidence.relevant_quote: Transcription factor EB (TFEB), a major regulator of ALP, has emerged as a leading factor in addressing neurodegenerative disease pathology...

evidence.paper_title: Past, present, and future perspectives of transcription factor EB (TFEB): mechanisms of regulation and association with disease
evidence.authors: Tan A, Prasad R, Lee C, Jho EH
evidence.relevant_quote: TFEB is also implicated in various human diseases, such as lysosomal storage disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, cancers, and metabolic disorders.

mechanism: Protein Kinase C Beta (PRKCB) directly phosphorylates TFEB on multiple serine residues in its C-terminal region (e.g., S462, S463, S467, S469).
effect: Phosphorylation by PRKCB enhances the stability and activity of the TFEB protein, leading to an accumulation of TFEB and subsequent upregulation of its target genes.
summary: TFEB activates PRKCB to modulate tfeb phosphorylation & protein stabilization, ultimately affecting lysosomal biogenesis is promoted.
